NUMEROUS-NUMEROUS-NUMEROUS COS. BOUGHT BACK SHARES that have good earnings/better sales increases & a LOT less shares than the over 1 billion yahoo's has & their stock still declined in the past 7 months! i hope there is more than 10 seconds of enthusiasm if only a share buy back is announced. even if more than 10 seconds i hope the stock isn't down at the end of the day!

Message.Title: Taking Yahoo private
Message.Msg: A possible scenario that could play out in the coming months is a deal in which MSFT spins its online division into YHOO, taking the latter private under Melissa Mayer, with MSFT being the major outside shareholder. This would provide an immediate boost to MSFT, separating the company's loss making online division from the very profitable core businesses. It would provide an immediate boost to Yahoo's long-suffering shareholders, as a buyout price would have to be $21+. And, crucially, the new entity would be better placed than either the current MSFT or YHOO to compete with the likes of GOOG and FB going forward, as it would be a strengthened and major player in both search and display and able to attract the necessary talent to compete given the possibility of a future IPO.

Topic.Title: Taking Yahoo private

Message.Msg: This has been talked about alot here for many months and the principal has merit. It would make sense for both shareholders and employees.

Topic.Title: Has anyone seen anything of the expanded relationship with FB per the litigation settlement??

Message.Msg: Still nothing on this topic huh? Well, just goes to show how little most posters know about Yahoo and/or their partners. Buying a stock betting on a takeover is a suckers bet and boy has it been proven their are a lot of suckers on this board. Along with a bunch of Yahoo employees that don't add value to the company.

Topic.Title: Taking Yahoo private

Message.Msg: I can't help but laugh at the continual posting of a dream that somehow MSFT's Board along with Ballmer and Gates want to save Yahoo shareholders from themselves. Bing is slowly taking search share and I believe that the whole Internet business for MSFT is defensive against Goog. Rather like the US Military's 2 front war strategy. Fight one to win, fight the second to hold the enemy in place so you can win the first one. Then fight the second one to win. If that is the case with MSFT then they don't want to give up control of the Internet business to save a few bucks, but they also have no intention of investing a whole lot more in the Business. So under this scenario MSFT is going to fight to win the war against Goog in the Microsoft Office and applications sector where they make a fortune and hold Goog from becoming even more dominant in the On-line sector. No need for MSFT to own Yahoo.

Message.Title: MARISSA THE SETTLEMENTS FOR VRNG ARE STARTING, ACT QUICKLY AND BUY THEM FOR $12
Message.Msg: Your window of opportunity is closing, you have a chace to be a game changer. business is business and you need to act boldy while you can to make your mark and enforce it. there are billions at stake here and it happens to be with goog who didn't recognize the talent they had. make them now realize. marissa i urge you to read the court filings. yahoo bought overture and goog paid $200 mill to settle patent infringement. yahoo was paid and goog paid the wrong party. the pto ruled vrng and (lang) are the creators of the technology that goog has been thriving on. read it and act quickly and decisively!! buy vrng for $12/share and offer roles to the developers and owners of the search sorting technology. most of the industry is using this technology created by lang, first art as declared by the patent office.

Message.Title: Why Yahoo's New CEO Will FAIL?!
Message.Msg: Yahoo failure has to do with serious problem. No new CEO can bring a failing company back to life, and no one has done it before. Those who built Yahoo should have come back to re-invent the company but that seems not possible. The new CEO can try but I have no doubt that she wont make it!
